semantic_issues: The Employee class does not specify the types of attributes (id and name) which should be defined as integers and strings respectively.
The Manager and Developer classes do not inherit the attributes from the Employee class, which is necessary to represent the full structure of an employee.
recommendations: Define the types of attributes in the Employee class (e.g., id: int, name: string).
Ensure that Manager and Developer classes inherit the attributes from the Employee class to maintain a complete representation of an employee.
Consider adding visibility modifiers (e.g., + for public) to the attributes for better clarity.
